snp1.3:15.2: The exact nuance of this line is hard to pin down. Later Pali texts equate _abhilāpa_ with “naming”, but it doesn’t seem to occur in any early texts with this sense. However _lapanā_ is used in the sense of “flattery” in eg. [mn117:29.2]().
snp1.3:19.2: _Padumī_ is a word for “elephant”, after the lotus-like spots or mottles on an elephant’s body, or else due to their fondness for lotuses (_padmaprasaktyā_, Mātaṅgalīla); elephants are often seen bathing and eating in lotus ponds.
snp1.3:22.2: The reference is to the smelting of gold, [an3.101:1.9]().
